rules: Rule1: Provided that a storm is approaching the coastal area, a public warning is issued.
Rule2: Either a storm is approaching the coastal area or government approval is received.
Rule3: Either the senior meteorologist approves or the forecasting team recommends.
Rule4: Whenever the forecasting team recommends, then if it is not true that satellite imagery being available implies the forecast model is reliable, then prediction confidence is not low.
Rule5: The emergency committee convenes or the operations center activates.

Rule6: Assuming the operations center activates, then if the senior meteorologist approves, then if it is not true that satellite imagery availability results in forecast model reliability, prediction confidence is not low.
Rule7: If an evacuation order is issued, then it is not the case that a storm is approaching the coastal area.
Rule8: If alternate routes are established, then traffic flow is smooth.
Rule9: When the police department deploys, then if it is not the case that mandatory evacuation activation leads to an evacuation order being issued, alternate routes are established.
Rule10: In the case that the national guard mobilizes, then if it is not true that mandatory evacuation being activated implies an evacuation order is issued, alternate routes are established.
Rule11: Whenever utility services are restored, then if repair crews are dispatched, the communication network is not operational.
Rule12: Under the condition that damage assessment is completed, utility services are restored.
Rule13: If emergency funds are allocated, then utility services are restored.
Rule14: Either federal assistance is requested, or damage assessment is completed, or emergency funds are allocated.
Rule15: If a public warning is issued, then residents are evacuated.
Rule16: When residents are evacuated, the emergency shelters protocol is activated.
Rule17: Severe damage to infrastructure occurs or government approval is received.
Rule18: If backup generators are functioning, then the communication network is not operational.
Rule19: Provided that weather data is accurate, satellite imagery is available.
Rule20: If it is not the case that satellite imagery availability implies forecast model reliability, then prediction confidence is low.

Rule21: In the event that it is not the case that emergency committee convening entails that if the senior meteorologist approves, then if satellite imagery availability does not imply forecast model reliability, prediction confidence is not low, then a critical decision delay occurs.
Rule22: If neither the police department deploys nor the national guard mobilizes, then law enforcement is insufficient.
Rule23: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the police department deploys or the national guard mobilizes, then law enforcement is not insufficient.
Rule24: In the case that it is not true that a widespread power outage leads to no severe infrastructure damage, then repair crews are dispatched.
Rule25: If it is not the case that a widespread power outage implies no severe damage to infrastructure, then the communication network is operational.
Rule26: Provided that it is not the case that a widespread power outage results in no severe infrastructure damage, backup generators are functioning.
Rule27: In the event that government approval is not received, then weather data is accurate.
facts: Fact2: A widespread power outage happens.
Fact3: The forecast model is not reliable.
Fact4: It is not the case that a critical decision delay occurs.
Fact5: The emergency shelters protocol is not activated.
Fact6: Traffic flow is not smooth.
Fact7: Federal assistance is not requested.
